nodes.title: Foxconn
nodes.short_description: Largest EMS competitor, competes for device assembly contracts, affecting Wistron volumes and pricing.

nodes.title: Pegatron
nodes.short_description: Major EMS competitor in handsets and PCs, directly contests contract awards.

nodes.title: Dell Technologies
nodes.short_description: OEM client for PCs/servers; purchasing decisions drive Wistron orders.

nodes.title: HP Inc.
nodes.short_description: Major PC OEM customer; sourcing shifts significantly affect Wistron revenue.

nodes.title: Wiwynn
nodes.short_description: Wistron’s server ODM spin-off; performance and orders from hyperscalers materially affect group results.

nodes.title: Tata Electronics
nodes.short_description: Acquired Wistron’s India iPhone unit, altering Wistron’s footprint and revenue mix.

nodes.title: Production Linked Incentive (PLI) for Large Scale Electronics Manufacturing
nodes.short_description: India subsidy program shaping electronics manufacturing investment and eligibility.

nodes.title: U.S. Section 301 tariffs on Chinese goods
nodes.short_description: U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports driving factory location and cost decisions.

nodes.title: China
nodes.short_description: Major manufacturing base; regulations, labor, and geopolitics impact operations and costs.

nodes.title: India
nodes.short_description: Key production location; policy, labor, and incentives affect investments and output.

nodes.title: Taiwan
nodes.short_description: Headquarters location guiding strategy, finance, and governance across Wistron group.

nodes.title: U.S.–China trade war
nodes.short_description: Geopolitical conflict causing tariffs, restrictions, and supply chain shifts.

nodes.title: COVID-19 pandemic
nodes.short_description: Global health crisis disrupting factories, logistics, and labor availability.
